intro: Onosma kilouyensis, commonly known as the Kilouy Mountain sandthrift, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It is often found in high-altitude areas, where it thrives in the cool, dry climate. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
